elementSpec.desc: contains material which is marked as (ostensibly) quoted from elsewhere; in narrative, this element is used to mark direct or indirect speech; in dictionaries, it ay be used to mark real or contrived examples of usage; in manuscript descriptions or other metadata, to mark extracts quoted from the source being documented.

attDef.desc: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is spoken or thought, or to characterize it more finely.

valItem.gloss: representation of direct speech, usually marked by quotation marks.
representation of thought, e.g. internal monologue.

attDef.desc: may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.

valItem.gloss: speech or thought is represented directly.
speech or thought is represented indirectly, e.g. by use of a marked verbal aspect.
